claim.body: a mixture comprising an aluminum source and an organo halocarbon activator into an internal cavity of an article; and heating the article and the mixture to a temperature sufficient to form an aluminum halide, which deposits on a surface of the internal cavity to form a coated article.
claim.claim-text: 1. A method comprising: introducing a mixture comprising an aluminum source and an organo halocarbon activator into an internal cavity of an article; and heating the article and the mixture to a temperature sufficient to form an aluminum halide, which deposits on a surface of the internal cavity to form a coated article.

claim.body: further comprising: depositing on an external surface of the article a first layer comprising Pt, Si, and a reactive element selected from the group consisting of Hf, Y, La, Ce, Zr, and combinations thereof; and depositing a second layer comprising Al on the first layer to form an alloy including a —Ni+γ′-Ni 3 Al phase constitution, wherein the second layer is deposited with the organo halocarbon activator.
claim.claim-text: 2. The method of claim 1 , further comprising: depositing on an external surface of the article a first layer comprising Pt, Si, and a reactive element selected from the group consisting of Hf, Y, La, Ce, Zr, and combinations thereof; and depositing a second layer comprising Al on the first layer to form an alloy including a —Ni+γ′-Ni 3 Al phase constitution, wherein the second layer is deposited with the organo halocarbon activator.

claim.body: the second layer comprising Al comprises electrophoretically depositing the second layer comprising Al.
claim.claim-text: 3. The method of claim 2 , wherein depositing the second layer comprising Al comprises electrophoretically depositing the second layer comprising Al.

claim.body: the article and mixture comprises heating the article, mixture, first layer and second layer to a temperature sufficient to form an aluminum halide from the aluminum source and the organo halocarbon activator in the mixture and from the Al and the organo halocarbon activator in the second layer.
claim.claim-text: 4. The method of claim 2 , wherein heating the article and mixture comprises heating the article, mixture, first layer and second layer to a temperature sufficient to form an aluminum halide from the aluminum source and the organo halocarbon activator in the mixture and from the Al and the organo halocarbon activator in the second layer.

claim.body: the surface of the internal cavity prior to introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 5. The method of claim 1 , further comprising preparing the surface of the internal cavity prior to introducing the mixture.

claim.body: at least one of a film cooling hole and a trailing edge exit slot with a masking material prior to introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 6. The method of claim 1 , further comprising masking at least one of a film cooling hole and a trailing edge exit slot with a masking material prior to introducing the mixture.

claim.body: the masking material comprises an aluminum source.
claim.claim-text: 7. The method of claim 6 , wherein the masking material comprises an aluminum source.

claim.body: a metering plate orifice with a masking material after introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 8. The method of claim 1 , further comprising masking a metering plate orifice with a masking material after introducing the mixture.

claim.body: the masking material comprises an aluminum source.
claim.claim-text: 9. The method of claim 8 , wherein the masking material comprises an aluminum source.

claim.body: heat treating the coated article.
claim.claim-text: 10. The method of claim 1 , further comprising heat treating the coated article.

claim.body: the mixture comprises a dry slurry including aluminum, the organo halocarbon activator and a filler.
claim.claim-text: 11. The method of claim 1 , wherein the mixture comprises a dry slurry including aluminum, the organo halocarbon activator and a filler.

claim.body: the dry slurry comprises about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of the aluminum source and about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of the organo halocarbon activator.
claim.claim-text: 12. The method of claim 11 , wherein the dry slurry comprises about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of the aluminum source and about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of the organo halocarbon activator.

claim.body: the filler comprises a particle size of about 1 micron to about 160 microns.
claim.claim-text: 13. The method of claim 11 , wherein the filler comprises a particle size of about 1 micron to about 160 microns.

claim.body: the filler comprises a particle size of about 90 microns to about 160 microns.
claim.claim-text: 14. The method of claim 13 , wherein the filler comprises a particle size of about 90 microns to about 160 microns.

claim.body: the mixture comprises a wet slurry including aluminum and the organo halocarbon activator in a liquid carrier.
claim.claim-text: 15. The method of claim 1 , wherein the mixture comprises a wet slurry including aluminum and the organo halocarbon activator in a liquid carrier.

claim.body: the wet slurry comprises solids including about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of the aluminum source and about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of the organo halocarbon activator.
claim.claim-text: 16. The method of claim 15 , wherein the wet slurry comprises solids including about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of the aluminum source and about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of the organo halocarbon activator.

claim.body: the aluminum source comprises at least one of elemental aluminum, an aluminum-chromium alloy, an organo-aluminum compound, or an aluminum-chromium-manganese alloy.
claim.claim-text: 17. The method of claim 1 , wherein the aluminum source comprises at least one of elemental aluminum, an aluminum-chromium alloy, an organo-aluminum compound, or an aluminum-chromium-manganese alloy.

claim.body: the organo halocarbon activator comprises at least one of a fluoropolymer and a chloropolymer.
claim.claim-text: 18. The method of claim 1 , wherein the organo halocarbon activator comprises at least one of a fluoropolymer and a chloropolymer.

claim.body: the organo halocarbon activator comprises polytetrafluoroethylene.
claim.claim-text: 19. The method of claim 1 , wherein the organo halocarbon activator comprises polytetrafluoroethylene.

claim.body: the article and mixture comprises heating the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1400° F. to about 1975° F.
claim.claim-text: 20. The method of claim 1 , wherein heating the article and mixture comprises heating the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1400° F. to about 1975° F.

claim.body: the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. comprises heating the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1500° F.
claim.claim-text: 21. The method of claim 20 , wherein heating the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. comprises heating the article and mixture to a temperature of about 1500° F.

22. A method comprising: depositing on an external surface of an article a first layer comprising Pt, Si, and a reactive element selected from the group consisting of Hf, Y, La, Ce, Zr, and combinations thereof; introducing a mixture comprising aluminum and an organo halocarbon activator into an internal cavity of the article; and depositing a second layer comprising Al on the first layer to form an alloy including a —Ni+γ′-Ni 3 Al phase constitution, wherein the second layer is deposited with the organo halocarbon activator.

claim.body: the second layer comprising Al comprises electrophoretically depositing the second layer comprising Al.
claim.claim-text: 23. The method of claim 22 , wherein depositing the second layer comprising Al comprises electrophoretically depositing the second layer comprising Al.

claim.body: the second layer is deposited from an electrophoretic suspension comprising solids including about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of an Al source, about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of an organo halocarbon activator, and a filler.
claim.claim-text: 24. The method of claim 23 , wherein the second layer is deposited from an electrophoretic suspension comprising solids including about 0.5 wt. % to about 25 wt. % of an Al source, about 1 wt. % to about 10 wt. % of an organo halocarbon activator, and a filler.

claim.body: further comprising preparing the surface of the internal cavity prior to introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 25. The method of claim 22 , further comprising preparing the surface of the internal cavity prior to introducing the mixture.

claim.body: further comprising masking at least one of a film cooling hole and a trailing edge exit slot with a masking material prior to introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 26. The method of claim 22 , further comprising masking at least one of a film cooling hole and a trailing edge exit slot with a masking material prior to introducing the mixture.

claim.body: the masking material comprises an aluminum source.
claim.claim-text: 27. The method of claim 26 , wherein the masking material comprises an aluminum source.

claim.body: further comprising masking a metering plate orifice with a masking material after introducing the mixture.
claim.claim-text: 28. The method of claim 22 , further comprising masking a metering plate orifice with a masking material after introducing the mixture.

claim.body: the masking material comprises an aluminum source.
claim.claim-text: 29. The method of claim 28 , wherein the masking material comprises an aluminum source.

claim.body: further comprising heat treating the article.
claim.claim-text: 30. The method of claim 22 , further comprising heat treating the article.

claim.body: the mixture comprises a dry slurry including aluminum, the organo halocarbon activator and a filler.
claim.claim-text: 31. The method of claim 22 , wherein the mixture comprises a dry slurry including aluminum, the organo halocarbon activator and a filler.

claim.body: the mixture comprises a wet slurry including aluminum and the organo halocarbon activator in a liquid carrier.
claim.claim-text: 32. The method of claim 22 , wherein the mixture comprises a wet slurry including aluminum and the organo halocarbon activator in a liquid carrier.

claim.body: the organo halocarbon activator comprises polytetrafluoroethylene.
claim.claim-text: 33. The method of claim 22 , wherein the organo halocarbon activator comprises polytetrafluoroethylene.

claim.body: further comprising: heating the article and mixture to about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. to form an aluminum halide, which deposits on a surface of the internal cavity to form a coated article.
claim.claim-text: 34. The method of claim 22 , further comprising: heating the article and mixture to about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. to form an aluminum halide, which deposits on a surface of the internal cavity to form a coated article.

claim.body: the article and mixture to about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. comprises heating the article and mixture to about 1500° F.
claim.claim-text: 35. The method of claim 34 , wherein heating the article and mixture to about 1400° F. to about 1975° F. comprises heating the article and mixture to about 1500° F.

claim.body: the mixture comprises 0.5 wt % to 25 wt % of an Al source and 1 wt % to 10 wt % of an organo halocarbon activator selected from at least one of a fluoropolymer and a chloropolymer.
claim.claim-text: 36. The method of claim 1 , wherein the mixture comprises 0.5 wt % to 25 wt % of an Al source and 1 wt % to 10 wt % of an organo halocarbon activator selected from at least one of a fluoropolymer and a chloropolymer.
